meanings.definition: Prepare and issue for public distribution or sale.
meanings.sent1: I will publish my new book next month.
meanings.sent2: Authors often publish their work to share it with readers.
meanings.sent3: The author was excited to publish his book and share it with the world.
meanings.sent4: She decided to publish her thoughts like a beacon in the dark.
meanings.sent5: The act of publishing a book is like sending a message in a bottle across the sea.

meanings.definition: Make information available to the public.
meanings.sent1: The newspaper will publish the latest news tomorrow.
meanings.sent2: Libraries often publish important information for everyone to access.
meanings.sent3: The teacher decided to publish the exam results on the notice board.
meanings.sent4: The internet has made it easy to publish information instantly to the world.
meanings.sent5: The radio station will publish the weather forecast every hour for listeners.

meanings.definition: To print and distribute written material.
meanings.sent1: The company will publish the new brochure for customers.
meanings.sent2: Publishing houses often publish books in large quantities.
meanings.sent3: The author was thrilled to publish his novel and see it in bookstores.
meanings.sent4: The printer will publish the flyers for the upcoming event.
meanings.sent5: The newspaper will publish the special edition with exclusive content.
